currentDoc:
Should Schools Provide Free Pads and Tampons?

Have you ever experienced period shaming, or “period poverty”? Should schools step in to help? Should schools be required to provide free pads and tampons to students? How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

Have you ever experienced period shaming, or “period poverty”? Should schools step in to help? Should schools be required to provide free pads and tampons to students? How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should provide free pads and tampons to students. I believe that pads and tampons are similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools. They are a basic life need.  They should be made easily accessible to students, just like toilet paper and soap. I believe no student should go without hygiene products and fear asking for help. I would promote this idea by speaking to my principal and other teachers about the importance of providing free pads and tampons in schools. It is a topic that some people are embarrassed to bring up. I would be willing to speak up and help make a difference. I would be willing to help improve health and hygiene for students. Have you ever experienced period shaming, or “period poverty”? Should schools step in to help? Should schools be required to provide free pads and tampons to students? How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should provide free pads and tampons to students. I believe that pads and tampons are similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools. They are a basic life need.  They should be made easily accessible to students, just like toilet paper and soap. I believe no student should go without hygiene products and fear asking for help. I would promote this idea by speaking to my principal and other teachers about the importance of providing free pads and tampons in schools. It is a topic that some people are embarrassed to bring up. I would be willing to speak up and help make a difference. I would be willing to help improve health and hygiene for students.  I think it would be good to get students and parents involved in speaking up as well.   I believe that students should be able to feel comfortable asking for pads and tampons and for voicing their opinion.   I believe that students should have a say in what is provided in schools.

How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should provide free pads and tampons to students. I believe that pads and tampons are similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools. They are a basic life need.  They should be made easily accessible to students, just like toilet paper and soap. I believe no student should go without hygiene products and fear asking for help. I would promote this idea by speaking to my principal and other teachers about the importance of providing free pads and tampons in schools. It is a topic that some people are embarrassed to bring up. I would be willing to speak up and help make a difference. I would be willing to help improve health and hygiene for students.  I think it would be good to get students and parents involved in speaking up as well.   I believe that students should be able to feel comfortable asking for pads and tampons and for voicing their opinion.   I believe that students should have a say in what is provided in schools.
